title: Osteoporosis Self Assessment Tool (OST)
description: Predicts risk of osteoporosis based on age and body weight. Simple screening tool to identify individuals who may benefit from further bone density testing with DXA scanning.

ranges.interpretation: This patient scores above 1 on the OST scale for women, indicating low risk of osteoporosis. Routine screening may be appropriate based on other risk factors and clinical guidelines.

This patient scores between -3 and 1 on the OST scale for women, indicating intermediate risk of osteoporosis. Consider bone density testing (DXA scan) based on clinical judgment and other risk factors.

This patient scores below -3 on the OST scale for women, indicating high risk of osteoporosis. Bone density testing (DXA scan) is strongly recommended. The original validation study showed 91% sensitivity and 45% specificity for identifying osteoporosis.
This patient scores above 3 on the OST scale for men, indicating low risk of osteoporosis. Routine screening may be appropriate based on other risk factors and clinical guidelines.

This patient scores between -1 and 3 on the OST scale for men, indicating intermediate risk of osteoporosis. Consider bone density testing (DXA scan) based on clinical judgment and other risk factors.

This patient scores below -1 on the OST scale for men, indicating high risk of osteoporosis. Bone density testing (DXA scan) is strongly recommended. The validation study showed 93% sensitivity and 66% specificity for identifying osteoporosis in men.

references: Koh LK, Sedrine WB, Torralba TP, Kung A, Fujiwara S, Chan SP, et al. A simple tool to identify asian women at increased risk of osteoporosis. Osteoporos Int. 2001;12(8):699-705. doi: 10.1007/s001980170070.
Adler RA, Tran MT, Petkov VI. Performance of the Osteoporosis Self-assessment Screening Tool for osteoporosis in American men. Mayo Clin Proc. 2003 Jun;78(6):723-7. doi: 10.4065/78.6.723.

Richy F, Gourlay M, Ross PD, Sen SS, Radican L, De Ceulaer F, et al. Validation and comparative evaluation of the osteoporosis self-assessment tool (OST) in a Caucasian population from Belgium. QJM. 2004 Jan;97(1):39-46. doi: 10.1093/qjmed/hch002.

Richards JS, Lazzari AA, Teves Qualler DA, Desale S, Howard R, Kerr GS. Validation of the osteoporosis self-assessment tool in US male veterans. J Clin Densitom. 2014 Jan-Mar;17(1):32-7. doi: 10.1016/j.jocd.2013.02.004.
formula: OST = (weight in kg - age in years) Ã— 0.2, truncated to integer
notes: Validated for use in men and women aged 40 years and older
Not a diagnostic tool - intended to identify who may benefit from DXA scanning
Different risk thresholds for men and women
Comparable performance to other osteoporosis risk assessment tools
Does not account for all osteoporosis risk factors
